comments.commentBody: Elizabeth Warren would be an excellent choice.  She is intelligent, insightful, experienced and capable.  Certainly, her demonstrated ability to gather and analyze information and to plan and organize would mean that the new consumer protection agency would be highly efficient and effective.  Exactly what is needed.

We keep spending our money on foreign wars. There are no other first rank countries that spend the same percentage of their GDP on the military; we are unique idiots. We must stop spending money outside this country. It doesn't increase our security, it only destroys our economy. We need to give up on trying to sell democracy all over the World; let some other country do it. Our leaders should concern themselves with our well being, not the well being of other countries.

I for one don't give a damn about Iraq and whether it is a democracy or an autocracy. As to Afghanistan, let them grow their poppy and be happy. Bring our troops home and with the money we save we can pay social security for another generation without any problem.

According to the Social Security Administration, illegal immigrants have contributed more than $400 billion to the Social Security fund since the 1980s, yet they are not eligible to take advantage of SS or Medicare. More than 75 percent of immigrants arrive in their prime working years, and they have subsidizing SS beneficiaries for decades.

According to the California Immigrant Policy Center immigrants pay approximately $5.2 billion in state income taxes each year; they contribute an additional $4.6 billion in sales taxes. Immigrants in California have a combined federal tax contribution of more than $30 billion annually. In California,the average immigrant-headed household contributes a net $2,679 annually to Social Security, which is $539 more than the average US-born household.

Social programs like welfare and food stamps constitute less than 1 percent of the federal budget, compared to the nearly 60 percent of the federal budget made up by Social Security and Medicare. Yes, this is welfare. Most people receive the money they put in SS plus interest in four years. In Medicare, it's 1-2 years. This is the real welfare program but the media doesn't dwell on it because the majority of its beneficiaries are and have always been white.

About 28 percent of L.A. County residents are baby boomers who will eventually need to be replaced in the workforce, many of them by immigrants. With more than 80 million baby boomers retiring in the next 20 years, it will be these immigrants who will provide a social security check so that these people won't die in poverty.

It is ironic that most of the anti-immigrant groups are made up of white elderly, who are being supported by immigrants. That is the truth.

All you need to know about the Social Security Trust Fund can be found here:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Security_debate_(United_States)

To quote:
"Starting in 2016, program expenses begin to exceed revenues. This is due to the aging of the baby-boom generation (resulting in a lower ratio of paying workers to retirees),[2] expected continuing low birth rate (compared to the baby-boom period), and increasing life expectancy. Further, the government has borrowed and spent the accumulated surplus funds, called the Social Security Trust Fund, while counting the funds as revenue, not debt.[2] During 2008, the fund held $2.4 trillion in government bonds—essentially "IOUs" or claims on the government's general fund or tax revenues. This amount is part of the total national debt of $11.3 trillion as of May 12, 2009.[3] By 2016, the government is expected to have borrowed nearly $3.7 trillion against the Social Security Trust fund.[4] Between 2016 and 2037, Social Security has the legal authority to draw amounts from other government tax sources besides the payroll tax, to fully fund the program.

(continued from a previous post..forgot about this)

I had meant to include the fact that in the early 90s the Canadian pension plan ws going broke. The Government of the day made a tough decision. They raised the payin rate for employees and employers. No one liked it. But in the end this has built a solid pension system in Canada. Maybe you (right wingers) think this is socialism. And it is. Better than throwing people on the street.

Just another Canadian comment.

1-Get rid of spousal entitlements for everyone under 55 today. They favor the rich and cheat singles and two-income couples. Replace them with credits for rearing children and staying out of the workforce (for a limited number of years).

2-Apply Medicare taxes to all investments, including home sales, and inheritances.

3-Take homeownership into consideration as part of means-testing for any retirement benefits. After the mortgage bailouts, many non-owners will never be able to buy. They shouldn't be penalized in the future by having benefits they earned reduced while people with assets they didn't earn (real estate) get full benefits.

“She starts with a skepticism of markets and a skepticism of the ability of consumers to make sensible choices.”

One ought to be skeptical since THEY (the large banks and more) ALMOST COLLAPSED THE ECONOMY, and there is predatory lending and much much more and so how they can say with a straight face that they are clean and on the up and up is beyond me.

"Once and for all would some Republican please tell me exactly what they have against health care for all US citizens? Social Security is liked by all older people and many on both "sides" have it as their retirement along with Medicare. "

-----------------------------

We get these programs are popular. We get that once enacted these things can't be touched. We get they often grow. We get they consume the bulk of our taxes. We get they still aren't paid for.

This is one problem that is easily dealt with: remove the income cap on FICA.

I recall rather vividly an occasion when a highly-paid colleague made much of the fact that his January paycheck took care of all he was required to pay into this most basic of community-enhancing programs.
Oh,how I wish we had more Elizabeth Warrens. She's tough, she's smart and we need her in there fighting.

As I read the story, the screen got very blurry - most humble condolences, by the way - and then I got to the part about the "sitting crossword" and I couldn't restrain myself. As a large guffaw escaped my lips to think of how incredibly touching and clever, I was reminded of one of those days when the sun comes out suddenly during a rain shower, smiling through tears.

Quite a man, husband, and father. More than words, in Dan's case.
My grandmother used to say, "He was too good for this world." That sounds about right for Dan. A good guy. A great talent.
wow, i'm all choked up. reading the blog was even more wonderful than solving this ingenious puzzle.
The miscreants in the financial services industry leadership don't like her? Must be a good choice.
what a charming and funny puzzle--full of personality.   and what a beautiful family.   my sympathies for their loss, and gratitude for being able to know him through his puzzles.

What I think this all means is that everybody loves a winner. Everybody but Republicans, that is. In the viral video of the day, some wonderful videographer named Josh Stanley has repurposed the Obama "Yes We Can" song by splicing in the musical contribution of House Minority Leader John Boehner yelling at the top of his lungs, presumably on the House floor, "Hell no you can't!" causing a poetic commenter to swoon, "Oh Internet. How I love your series of tubes." Another commented that only Boehner is off-key. Yes He Is. The video captures the essence of this moment: democracy ascendant, Republicans raging out of control.

Even among all the horrible violence & death threats against Members of Congress who did the right thing for the American people, there is one glimmer of light: the Secret Service reports that threats against President Obama are down to the levels of threats to former Presidents.

And in another sign of reversal of fortunes, the Democratic National Committee has co-opted one of the tea-partiers' favorite signs, "Hands Off My Health Care." Yep, they're warning that Republicans want to take health insurance away from your kids & drop seniors back into the donut hole. May the next mob be made up of Democratic activists locking arms & singing "Yes We Did" with will.i.am & John Legend.

Health reform is here to stay. It's a winner.

The Constant Weader at www.RealityChex.com

Gail, I am still waiting for somebody in the leadership of the Republican Party to come forward and tell all these "babies" stop the temper tantrum and grow up. If they think that the childish nonsense that they've been pulling is somehow going to attract moderates and independents back to them in November, they are kidding themselves. And now they are rallying up the crazies, threatening violence and assassinations upon Democrat's children and families. It's scary. All this from the party of family values. Their behavior is shameful.
No, health care was not reformed.  Health insurance was reformed.  Not the same thing.

America has become a lunatic asylum. When the Republicans passed the tax cut for the wealthy that helped precipitate the nation's deep slide into insolvency, where were the tea party protesters? When George W. Bush and his henchmen lied us into a war that sent thousands of sons and daughters to leave their blood and limbs and sanity in the sands of Babylon, where were the tea party protesters?

When the scandal of Abu Ghraib broke and the American people learned that our President, Vice President, and Attorney General abrogated the Geneva Conventions and allowed America to torture its captives, where were the Tea Party protesters?

During the six years the Congress was controlled by the Republicans they did everything they could to enhance the lot of the rich while at the same time severely damaging the middle class. Their "fair trade" policies cost America two million jobs. Where were the tea party protesters?

Maybe our madness is a symptom of our need to escape reality. Even so, the reality is there and persists and becomes even more maddening.

Unfortunately the obstinacy of the Republican party is not funny or cute. It is dangerous and anti-American, however much they drape red, white and blue and a fraudulent "Christianity" over themselves. Following the ugly "tea party" prior to the vote, and the physical attacks and threats after the vote, it is clear that the Republican party is encouraging such actions.
Obama should make an address, informing these people that they live in a democracy, majority vote wins, and any incitement or actual taking of violence will be dealt with by the law - whether coming from the mouths of Limbaugh, Beck or a foaming tea-partier on the street. If nothing is done we can anticipate shortly assassinations and jack-boots.
Not so funny.
www.jonjost.wordpress.com
www.cinemaelectronica.wordpress.com

How interesting that when the Republicans were in power they characterized any legalistic maneuvers in Congress as chicanery, or worse, treason. Abridging the freedoms of the American people, they used to scream. (It's always somehow got something to do with taking away "Our Freedom"...they've all seen too many re-runs of Braveheart.)

Now, however, Boehner and McConnell feel compelled to resort to those same maneuvers, to legalistic chicanery, to preserve "Our Freedom".

I am tempted to say that you can't have it both ways, boys, but that wouldn't matter to them. The only thing that matters to them is to gum up the works. To say NO as long as possible and with every fiber of their being to keep from doing the right thing, especially if that thing has been proposed by a black, Democrat who also happens to be *gasp* president.

There will be no transformation for such as those. After all, someone has to be there to keep those mean old Americans who need health care from stealing "Our Freedom".

When is the story ever going to be about the total obstruction of the Republicans? They apparently care nothing about the people of this country. Of course, since they don't believe in government, they don't care if it works. I will never understand why we elect people to Congress who do not believe in government. This makes no sense.

Long live the health care reform and kudos to everyone who helped make it possible!  As an Asian citizen who worked in New York, i think this is perhaps one of the best things that can happen to the average US citizen, and therefore for the country.  And no, David Brooks, i don't think it will necessarily mean the stagnation of the country's inventive genius and entrrepeneurial energy.

"The American people certainly seemed impressed, giving thumbs up to the new law in public opinion polls"

Just wait until the healthcare honeymoon is over and Americans find out that bills must still be paid. By Nov 2010 and 2012, both honeymoons will be long over.

Thomas Huynh
Sonshi.com
We should not export our "challenges" as this may lead to hard feelings, or at least a return ticket....
